business.headline: Laxmi India Finance IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check detailsThe IPO includes a fresh issue of 1.05 crore shares worth Rs 165.17 crore and an offer for sale of 56 lakh shares worth Rs 89.09 crore.
Sensex opens 200 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 62.31 points to 80,828.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7.20 points to 24,673.70 as of 9:26 am.

Who is P&G's new Indian-born global CEO, Shailesh JejurikarShailesh Jejurikar's promotion was announced as part of a leadership change at P&G. The company's current CEO, Jon R. Moeller, will move into the role of executive chairman.

Aditya Infotech IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPThe bidding window will remain open till July 31, 2025. Aditya Infotech IPO consists of a fresh issue worth Rs 500 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of shares worth Rs 800 crore by promoter group entities.

Brigade Hotel Ventures IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusThose who applied for shares can check their allotment status either on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or through the portal of KFin Technologies Limited, the official registrar for this IPO.

Should you be paying rent with credit card?More and more people are using credit cards to pay rent. But does the benefit of extra days to pay and cashback outweigh the fees and credit score impact? Let's break it down.
Sensex ends 572 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Kotak Bank down 7%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 572.07 points to end at 80,891.02, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 156.10 points to close at 24,680.90.

5 IPOs worth Rs 7,000 crore to open for bidding this week. Check detailsThis week, five mainboard IPOs are opening for bidding: NSDL (National Securities Depository), M&B Engineering, Sri Lotus Developers & Realty, Aditya Infotech, and Laxmi India Finance.

Can opting for old regime help you save tax in FY25?Many believe that under the new tax regime, there is no tax on income up to Rs 12 lakh. However, this change will only take effect from April 1, 2025, and will apply to returns filed for the FY26.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta slams Dior for ignoring Indian artisans behind $200K coatThe luxury brand Dior showcased a $200K coat adorned with traditional Lucknowi 'mukaish' embroidery. While 12 Indian artisans spent 34 days crafting it, their names, and India's contribution, went unacknowledged.

Is TCS cutting jobs because of AI? Here's what CEO K Krithivasan saysTCS CEO K Krithivasan said that the company is still looking for highly skilled professionals, especially those who can support TCS's plans to expand into new technologies and markets.

What homeowners need to know about house property tax rules, explains tax advisorBuying a home comes with more than just EMIs and maintenance; it brings tax implications too. Sujit Bangar, Founder of TaaxBuddy.com, breaks down the key rules every homeowner should be aware of to avoid surprises during filing season.

entertainment.headline: Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 5: Pawan Kalyan film nosedives, earns Rs 2 crorePawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' crashed at the box office on Monday on its fifth day in theatres. The film earned Rs 2 crore nett in India, which is more than a 50 per cent drop.

Avatar Fire and Ash trailer: Sullys, Na'vi set for war on land, air and waterJames Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' trailer was released early after a leak, heightening anticipation for the December 2025 film release. The trailer gave a glimpse of a full-blown war between the Sullys, Na'vi and Mangkwan clan.

In Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom, the rise, slump and the road to redemptionVijay Deverakonda has experienced a rollercoaster career marked by major hits and crushing failures. His upcoming film 'Kingdom' is seen as a crucial chance to revive his standing in Telugu cinema.

Saiyaara singer Faheem Abdullah collaborates with T-Series for new music projects'Saiyaara' singer Faheem Abdullah is all set for new beginnings in his music career. The singer-songwriter-composer has partnered with Bhushan Kumar's T-Series for his future music projects.

Taarak Mehta makers begged Disha Vakani to return, co-star Jennifer Mistry opens upActor Jennifer Mistry Bansiwal, best known as Roshan from 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah', shed light on Disha Vakani's exit from the show. She also revealed the behind-the-scenes efforts to bring her back.

Bakaiti trailer: Rajesh Tailang, Sheeba Chaddha navigate middle-class strugglesThe upcoming show 'Bakaiti' on ZEE5, is a slice-of-life story about a middle-class family in Ghaziabad. The series highlights everyday struggles and unspoken love in a household while dealing with chaos and generational tensions.

Ahaan Panday's private Instagram grabs attention amid Saiyaara craze'Saiyaara' actor Ahaan Panday's potential private Instagram account has come to light. The account is followed by popular celebrities like Ananya Panday and Khushi Kapoor.

20 years later, Shah Rukh Khan's Swades BTS pics go viral, fans get nostalgicThrowback BTS photos from Shah Rukh Khan's film 'Swades' have gone viral, bringing back memories for fans. People praised the film for showing Indian culture and said it should be released in theatres again.

Tanishk Bagchi denies Saiyaara track being copiedTanishk Bagchi denies allegations of copying tunes for 'Saiyaara' from One Direction and Jubin Nautiyal. The original Hindi track's global chart success challenges his image as just a recreation composer.

Hina Khan shares funny video with mother-in-law on shaadi ke side effectsActor Hina Khan shared a light-hearted video showcasing her relationship with her mother-in-law on Instagram. She playfully mentioned in the caption that the video is about the side effects of marriage.

Mahesh Bhatt says Alia is self-made, calls Ranbir laid-back: She is a go-getterVeteran producer-director Mahesh Bhatt recently called his daughter Alia Bhatt a self-made actor. Apart from Alia, he also shared his views on why son-in-law Ranbir Kapoor is a laid-back actor.

Parmeet Sethi recalls marital struggles with Archana Puran Singh: It was very tenseActor Parmeet Sethi opened up about his personal and marital struggles. He credited the Art of Living course for helping him find emotional peace during tough times with his wife Archana Puran Singh.

John Abraham hugs fan imitating Allu Arjun's Pushpa Raj, video goes viralJohn Abraham recently met a fan dressed as Pushpa Raj from Allu Arjun's film 'Pushpa'. The actor was so impressed by his act that he hugged him, and the video quickly went viral.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu poor VFX edited: Fans wonder why wasn't it done earlierActor Pawan Kalyan's epic-action-drama 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu: Part 1—Sword vs Spirit' was re-released in theatres with trimmed scenes and enhanced VFX. The changes caught the attention of movie-goers who questioned why it wasn't done earlier.

Mallika Sherawat sets record straight, says not doing Bigg Boss 19 and never willActor Mallika Sherawat confirmed on Monday that she will not be joining 'Bigg Boss 19'. She addressed rumours on her Instagram story, stating that she will never be seen on the show.

Rupali Ganguly seeks blessings from Lord Shiva at Mahakaleshwar temple, shares pics Rupali Ganguly visited the Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain with her husband to seek Lord Shiva's blessings on Sawan Somvar. The 'Anupamaa' star shared pictures from the spiritual visit, which are now going viral on social media.

Kaantha teaser: Dulquer Salmaan revives golden age cinema in tense period dramaThe teaser of 'Kaantha', starring Dulquer Salmaan and released on his birthday, offers a glimpse into a gripping 1950s Madras tale of artistic rivalry and ego clashes. The film will release in September.

Saiyaara hits global top 50 on Spotify - Krish dreamt it, the world played itSpoiler ahead! Krish Kapoor (played by Ahaan Panday) vows to make the 'Saiyaara' song so big that it reaches his love, Vaani Batra (Aneet Padda). It seems like fiction has become reality as the song has shot to the No. 1 spot on Spotify's Top 50 India and climbed to No. 4 on the Global Top 50 list.

Beyonce ends Cowboy Carter tour on historic note in Vegas. WatchSinger Beyonce brought the curtain down on her historic Cowboy Carter tour with a final performance in Las Vegas, featuring unexpected moments and special guest appearances.

general news.headline: Government denies claim of Nimisha Priya's death penalty being revoked: SourcesThe office of Grand Mufti of India claimed that Nimisha Priya's death sentence had been officially cancelled. The government has now rejected the claim.

5 dead in shooting at Manhattan building housing top firms, gunman killedA shooting at a midtown Manhattan office building, home to top companies like Blackstone, KPMG, Deutsche Bank, left five people dead, including a police officer.

No PM-Trump call between April 22–June 17: S Jaishankar rejects mediation claimsAs the Opposition began protesting S Jaishankar's statement that trade was not part of the talks between India and the US during Operation Sindoor, Union Home Minister Amit Shah intervened, saying that the Opposition was quick to dismiss their own foreign minister, "but they have faith in some other country."

I failed in life: 23-year-old Pune engineer jumps from office building, diesAn IT engineer in Pune was reportedly attending a meeting when he suddenly complained of chest pain and excused himself before jumping from the seventh floor of the office building.

Ben Stokes: Snubbed handshakes, swollen toes, and the 2019 World Cup robberyBen Stokes tried to play Gandhi with his handshake act in Manchester. But he will do well to remember how, only hours before that, he targetted Rishabh Pant's busted foot with searing yorkers.

Bus carrying kanwariyas collides with truck in Jharkhand, BJP MP says 18 killedInspector General (Dumka Zone) Shailendra Kumar Sinha told PTI that the 32-seater bus carrying Kanwariyas collided with a truck near Jamuniya forest in Mohanpur police station in Deoghar.

What is UPA's 2009 Balochistan blunder of Sharm El-SheikhResponding to the Opposition during the debate on Operation Sindoor, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar accused the UPA-2 government of inaction after the 2008 Mumbai attacks and referred to the 2009 Sharm El-Sheikh joint statement by then PM Manmohan Singh with his Pakistani counterpart Yusuf Raza Gilani. What is the Sharm El-Sheikh statement and its reference to Balochistan that is considered a blunder by the Singh-led UPA government?

Why Jagdeep Dhankhar's exit as vice-president will have little impact on BJPObservers believe Dhankhar was aptly rewarded for all that he might have done for the BJP. Few in the party are shedding public tears for him

MS Dhoni of the Chessboard: Meet Divya Deshmukh, new Women's World Cup winnerDivya Deshmukh showcased her remarkable ability to thrive under pressure by clinching the FIDE Women's World Cup 2025 title, a performance that drew comparisons to Indian cricket legend MS Dhoni for her calm temperament and finishing prowess on the biggest stage.

Video: Amit Shah loses cool as Opposition boos Jaishankar during Op Sindoor debateAmit Shah lashed out at the Opposition in Parliament after they repeatedly interrupted External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar during his statement on Operation Sindoor.

Video: Thar rams scooter in Jammu, driver reverses to hit elderly riderA Thar SUV hit an elderly man twice in Jammu, leaving him critically injured. Following the collision, which took place on Sunday, the driver fled the scene without assisting the injured man.

We sent them willingly: Families of girls deny conversion charges against nunsThe arrest of two Kerala nuns and a tribal man in Chhattisgarh has sparked protests nationwide, after the families of the three tribal women involved denied forced conversion and trafficking allegations.

In Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom, the rise, slump and the road to redemptionVijay Deverakonda has experienced a rollercoaster career marked by major hits and crushing failures. His upcoming film 'Kingdom' is seen as a crucial chance to revive his standing in Telugu cinema.

Pahalgam attack mastermind was caught napping - Inside details of Op MahadevOperation Mahadev was the result of a 14-day-long pursuit and involved coordinated action by the Army, CRPF, and J&K Police, with efforts still ongoing to identify the terrorists and track down their remaining associates.
In Bihar's 'Phulera', panchayat secretary takes on MLA, files case after threatIn his complaint, the panchayat secretary accused RJD MLA Bhai Virendra of hurling casteist abuse and issuing threats.

Surat woman assaulted, gangraped by husband and friends, thrown into river to dieA man in Surat brutally assaulted his wife and gangraped her with his friends over suspicion of an extramarital affair. They attempted to kill her by throwing her into the river.

Crumbling classrooms: India's public schools have become death traps for childrenSeven students died in Rajasthan's school roof collapse on Friday, exposing India's chronic underfunding of school infrastructure where accidents like this aren't surprising but tragically predictable.

Where's your diplomacy? Jaishankar says Tahawwur Rana, TRF terror tag is answerExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar slammed the Opposition, saying those who believed that inaction was the best response after the 26/11 terror attacks were questioning why Operation Sindoor was stopped.

School over for me: Bengali speakers in limbo amid crackdown on illegal immigrantsWhat started as a Home Ministry directive to identify illegal Bangladeshi nationals has, on the ground, become something else entirely. In Gurugram's Bengali-speaking migrant neighbourhoods, fear has replaced routine.

BJP's new renaming call in Bhopal has a Pakistan angle: Why the row?The demand is over Hamidia Hospital and Hamidia College, named after Hamidullah Khan, the last Nawab of Bhopal accused by some BJP leaders of being pro-Pakistan

The trailer gave a glimpse of a full-blown war between the Sullys, Na'vi and Mangkwan clan.

Trump puts world on notice: 15-20% tariffs for those without US trade dealsAs the August 1 tariff deadline looms, President Donald Trump said he could impose tariffs between 15 per cent to 20 per cent on imports to the US from countries negotiating trade deals with Washington.

Family of 4 falls into Jharkhand river while taking selfies, saved by localsThe family belonged to West Bengal's Bardhaman and had come to visit the Bhatinda Falls in Jharkhand, a popular natural attraction in the region.

Criticise state, face action: Maharashtra's social media rule for government staffAccording to the new social media guidelines, any form of misuse of the platform, including criticism of government policies, political events, or individuals, will not be tolerated.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 5: Pawan Kalyan film nosedives, earns Rs 2 crorePawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' crashed at the box office on Monday on its fifth day in theatres. The film earned Rs 2 crore nett in India, which is more than a 50 per cent drop.

The series highlights everyday struggles and unspoken love in a household while dealing with chaos and generational tensions.

sports.headline: Ben Stokes: Snubbed handshakes, swollen toes, and the 2019 World Cup robberyBen Stokes tried to play Gandhi with his handshake act in Manchester. But he will do well to remember how, only hours before that, he targetted Rishabh Pant's busted foot with searing yorkers.

Ravindra Jadeja earns overdue recognition as reliable Test batter in EnglandEngland vs India: Averaging 113.50 with four half-centuries and a century in eight innings, Ravindra Jadeja has not only reaffirmed his quality with the bat but also earned the long-overdue recognition as a reliable Test batter in England.

Khaleel Ahmed ends Essex stint early due to personal reasonsIndia left-arm pacer Khaleel Ahmed has withdrawn from his County Championship stint with Essex after featuring in just two first-class matches, citing personal reasons.

Why should India be nice to England? Boycott slams Ben StokesFormer England opener Geoffrey Boycott has slammed the Ben Stokes-led England team for their tactics and behaviour on Day 5 of the Manchester Test, questioning the drama that unfolded when Indian batters refused to settle for a draw.

KL Rahul like a monk, Jadeja the real deal: Aakash Chopra praises Indian duoKL Rahul's composed knock and Ravindra Jadeja's match-saving century helped India secure a draw in the fourth Test against England. Aakash Chopra lauded both players for their resilience, highlighting Rahul's disciplined approach and Jadeja's all-round brilliance as pivotal in keeping India's hopes alive in the series.

Supreme Court quashes FIR against Lakshya Sen in birth certificate forgery caseThe Supreme Court on Monday (July 28) quashed an FIR against national badminton star Lakshya Sen, along with his family members and coach, in a case related to alleged birth certificate forgery.

MS Dhoni of the Chessboard: Meet Divya Deshmukh, new Women's World Cup winnerDivya Deshmukh showcased her remarkable ability to thrive under pressure by clinching the FIDE Women's World Cup 2025 title, a performance that drew comparisons to Indian cricket legend MS Dhoni for her calm temperament and finishing prowess on the biggest stage.

Virat Kohli was set to be sacked as RCB captain in 2019, reveals ex IPL-teammateMoeen Ali revealed that Parthiv Patel was almost appointed RCB captain in 2019 during Gary Kirsten's coaching tenure. Virat Kohli, however, continued leading the side until 2021 when he decided to step down due to workload concerns.

Guardiola reveals plans after Manchester City stint, hints at decade-long breakPep Guardiola has reiterated his plan to step away from football management after his tenure at Manchester City, revealing that his sabbatical could last as long as 15 years.

Washington Sundar's father slams selection policy: My son doesn't get regular chancesWashington Sundar's father, Mr Mani Sundar, has questioned the inconsistent selection policy of the Indian selectors, stating that while other cricketers are given regular opportunities, his son is dropped even after a single failure.

Archer should not play Oval Test, Gus Atkinson can replace him: Stuart BroadEngland vs India: Stuart Broad has called for caution over Jofra Archer's workload, urging England not to risk the injury-prone pacer in the fifth and final Test against India at the Kia Oval.

Virat Kohli, however, continued leading the side until 2021 when he decided to step down due to workload concerns.

Archer should not play Oval Test, Gus Atkinson can replace him: Stuart BroadEngland vs India: Stuart Broad has called for caution over Jofra Archer's workload, urging England not to risk the injury-prone pacer in the fifth and final Test against India at the Kia Oval.

Shubman Gill picks best knock from historic England series: Most pleasing to meShubman Gill rates his Manchester Test hundred as his best knock in the England series. His innings helped India secure a crucial draw and matched a historic Bradman record.

Watch: Divya Deshmukh in tears, hugs mother after Chess World Cup winDivya Deshmukh, 19, won the Women's World Cup 2025 title by defeating veteran Koneru Humpy in a dramatic tie-break. Divya also achieved the Grandmaster title after becoming the first Indian to win the crown.

Indian football team to get new head coach on August 1, Jamil front-runnerThe AIFF executive committee will announce the new Indian men's football head coach on August 1. Khalid Jamil emerges as the frontrunner amid financial challenges and competition from experienced candidates.

Rishabh Pant provides update on foot injury, to begin rehab soonIndia vice-captain Rishabh Pant has thanked fans for their support and confirmed that he will begin rehabilitation once the fracture in his right foot heals.
Divya Deshmukh creates history, beats Koneru Humpy to win Women's World Cup 2025Divya Deshmukh created history as she defeated Koneru Humpy to win the Women's World Cup 2025 crown on Monday, July 28.

Should India push Jasprit Bumrah to play 5th Test vs England?India vs England: Jasprit Bumrah has already played his promised 3 Tests in England. Should he push for one more with the series on the line?

Indian Legends applaud resilient India fightback in Manchester Test drawIndia's remarkable fightback at Old Trafford has kept the five-match Test series alive. With standout performances from KL Rahul, Shubman Gill, Ravindra Jadeja, and Washington Sundar, the team displayed exceptional resilience, drawing praise from cricketing legends ahead of the series decider.
ENG vs IND: England add all-rounder to squad for Oval Test against IndiaEngland announced their squad for the Oval Test and decided to add Jamie Overton to the side for the upcoming clash.

ENG vs IND: England add all-rounder to squad for Oval Test against IndiaEngland announced their squad for the Oval Test and decided to add Jamie Overton to the side for the upcoming clash.

You expect him to take 10 wickets? Kapil Dev defends Anshul Kamboj after debutKapil Dev has jumped to the defence of young pacer Anshul Kamboj after his lacklustre debut in the Manchester Test for India. Kamboj failed to make a mark in his first match in India colours.

Want a hundred against Brook? Of course! Ashwin slams Stokes for 4th Test fiascoR Ashwin slammed Ben Stokes and England for the fiasco they created by trying to end the Manchester Test early and deny Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar hundreds on Sunday, July 27.

Watch Piastri's audacious overtake on Norris that won him Belgian GPOscar Piastri won the rain-delayed Belgian Grand Prix with a bold move on teammate Lando Norris. This victory extends his championship lead and adds to McLaren's dominance this season.

Fight for entire day: Sundar on mantra after brave hundred in 4th Test drawWashington Sundar revealed his mantra while batting on Day 5 when he scored a brave hundred in the Manchester Test. Sundar played a valiant role in securing the draw in the 4th Test.

Gambhir bats for injury replacements, Ben Stokes slams ridiculous ideaEngland captain Ben Stokes has voiced strong opposition to injury replacements in Test cricket. The debate follows Rishabh Pant's injury and contrasting views from India's coach Gautam Gambhir.

Injured Pant sends parting message to Team India after heroic Manchester drawRishabh Pant sent a parting message to the Indian team after their heroic draw in the Manchester Test. Pant showed grit and fought through pain to score a valiant fifty in the first innings of the fourth Test.

Manchester Test: A draw that felt like a winFrom 0 for 2 to 425 for 4 in the second innings, India turned what looked a defeat into a stirring draw in Manchester. A performance built on grit and defiance, it felt like a win and a momentum shift before the Oval finale.

Workload management can pause, India need Jasprit Bumrah in Oval Test deciderHaving secured a draw in the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford in Manchester, should India push Jasprit Bumrah to play in the fifth Test at the Oval with a chance of levelling the series still alive? With the series on the line, workload management can take a backseat, especially with no major tournaments lined up for the next four months.

Ben Stokes on asking for early draw: Didn't want to risk front-line bowlersEngland captain Ben Stokes revealed that he didn't want to risk his front-line bowlers and hence asked for an early draw in the fourth Test against India at OId Trafford in Manchester.

Tejaswin Shankar breaks national record, betters his previous markIndia's Tejaswin Shankar broke his own national decathlon record with 7826 points in Poland. This achievement marks a new milestone for Indian athletics and raises hopes for future international success.

Gambhir should tone it down, India succeeding despite his blunders: ManjrekarFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has urged Gautam Gambhir to tone down during his press conference while answering tough questions and also highlighted his tactical blunders.

India refuse early draw in Manchester, Stokes explodes. Who was right?India vs England: Shubman Gill's India pulled off a heroic draw in the Manchester Test match. Ravindra Jadeja got into a verbal tussle with Ben Stokes in the late hours of the final day.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
